data.title: PM urged to return land to monastery
data.description: Former senator Somchai Sawangkarn sent a third open letter to Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, urging her to expedite the return of a monastic plot of land acquired by Alpine Golf Course to Wat Thamikararam Worawihan, saying that the head of the government must perform her duties with honesty for the benefit of the country.

data.title: Key panel appointment for negotiation with Cambodia may face delay
data.description: The planned appointment of the Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with  Cambodia  on the development of  disputed maritime areas  in the  Gulf of Thailand  might not be tabled for the cabinet

data.title: New booze control bill nearly ready
data.description: The chairman of the special committee scrutinising new alcohol control legislation, Wisarn Techathirawat, said the draft of the  Alcoholic Beverage Control  Bill was about 80% complete and would be submitted to parliament in mid-December.

data.title: Stimulus plan in the works
data.description: The Finance Ministry will on Tuesday present a comprehensive economic stimulus package to a related committee chaired by Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra for consideration, said Deputy Finance Minister Julapun Amornvivat.

data.title: Ishii says Thai team need improvement
data.description: Thailand were held to a second draw in as many matches when Laos secured a 1-1 tie at Thammasat Stadium on Sunday night, but War Elephants coach Masatada Ishii said he will be keeping faith with the same squad for the next month

data.title: What Russia's invasion has cost Ukraine as war reaches 1000th day
data.description: KYIV - Russia

data.title: ONE Championship: Jacob Smith insists Rodtang elbow ‘changed the fight’, vows to return for title
data.description: Jacob Smith vowed to return for the ONE Championship flyweight Muay Thai title after admitting an elbow from Rodtang Jitmuangnon “changed the fight”.

data.title: Famous Thai voiceover team to wrap up its iconic career next year
data.description: Phantamit, known for dubbing big-screen hits like “The Storm Riders” and “Shaolin Soccer”, set to wrap up its 30-plus years in the Thai entertainment industry during Songkran

data.title: Inquiry into Thailand's rising dugong death toll expanded
data.description: Another  dugong  was found dead in Krabi on Sunday as the Natural Resources and Environment Minister Chalermchai Sri-on directed relevant authorities to expedite urgent measures concerning the  alarming increase  in the dugong death rate.

data.title: Thailand to return rare animals to Madagascar
data.description: Thailand will return over 900  lemurs  and rare  turtles  seized from the illegal wildlife trade to  Madagascar  this month, according to the Department of National Parks, Wildlife and Plant Conservation (DNP).

data.title: Singer quits Palang Pracharath Party amid extortion probe
data.description: Singer Rattapoom “Film” Tokongsup has resigned from the opposition Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) amid a probe into alleged  extortion  related to  The iCon Group  case.

data.title: Inquiry into increasing dugong death expanded
data.description: Another dugong was found dead in Krabi on Sunday as the Natural Resources and Environment Minister Chalermchai Sri-on directed relevant authorities to expedite urgent measures concerning the alarming increase in the dugong death rate.

data.title: Legal avenue regarding land dispute at Khao Kradong proposed
data.description: Key document in effect acknowledges that the land belongs to the SRT and is a public asset, lawyer says

data.title: Govt to return rare animals to Madagascar
data.description: Thailand will return over 900 lemurs and rare turtles seized from the illegal wildlife trade to Madagascar this month, according to the Department of National Parks, Wildlife and Plant Conservation (DNP).

data.title: Thai Airways launches debt-to-equity conversion as part of rehab plan
data.description: SEC gives the airline a go-ahead to get creditors to convert existing debt into equity, marking a huge step towards THAI exiting rehab

data.title: NHSO unveils first ‘Care Box’ in Bangkok to improve healthcare access
data.description: The kiosk connects patients with doctors to provide treatment for 42 common illnesses, helping residents save time and effort by eliminating the need to visit hospitals or clinics

data.title: Dredging of Ping River discussed to counter flooding in Chiang Mai
data.description: Local agencies in Chiang Mai province on Monday discussed a dredging operation in the Ping River in a bid to address flooding in the long term.

data.title: At least 8 killed as super typhoon struck Philippines
data.description: MANILA - At least eight people were killed as super typhoon Man-Yi hit the Philippine archipelago over the weekend, unleashing fierce winds and strong rains that triggered landslides and storm surges, authorities said.

data.title: Unlocking Large Language Models: A Guide for Leaders
data.description: Imagine a world where computers understand only human language but can also create and communicate nearly as effectively as humans. This is not just a daydream; it

data.title: Minor International Tops Thailand in TIME’s Global Ranking
data.description: Minor International Public Company Limited (MINT)    has been recogni s ed in the “World’s Best Companies 2024” by TIME magazine and Statista, the world-leading statistics portal and industry ranking provider. The prestigious recognition places Minor International at #425 out of 1,000 companies worldwide and ranks it as the #1 company in Thailand.

data.title: People's Party announces candidates to lead 12 PAOs
data.description: The People

data.title: Digital Economy Ministry targets online scams
data.description: ‘DE-fence’ platform designed to protect citizens from fraudulent calls and SMS text messages

data.title: Thai tuna industry commits to sustainable fishing, local sourcing
data.description: MoU underscores dedication to supporting local fishermen and adhering to international sustainability standards

data.title: Thanis Yaovapongaree: Elevating Premium Real Estate in Phuket
data.description: Mr Thanis Yaovapongaree began his career as a General Manager at CPF before fully committing to the real estate industry. He initially focused on developing rental apartments in Bangkok, including The Grand Mansion, City View, and 20 Boutique in the Lat Krabang and Huai Khwang areas. These projects not only provided steady income but also established a solid foundation for his real estate business, with a combined value of over 3 billion THB in apartment and condominium projects.

data.title: Thai economy shows resilience in Q3, positive outlook for 2024-2025
data.description: In the third quarter, several key economic drivers significantly contributed to growth, NESDC says

data.title: JKN risks SET delisting for delayed filing of Q1 financial statement
data.description: Shares of JKN Global Group are at risk of being delisted from the Stock Exchange of Thailand (SET) because of failure to submit a financial statement for the first quarter of 2024 within a specific time.

data.title: Singer quits Palang Pracharath Party amid extortion probe
data.description: Singer Rattapoom “Film” Tokongsup has resigned from the opposition Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) amid a probe into alleged  extortion  related to  The iCon Group  case.

data.title: Thailand increases flights to tackle New Year ticket price rise
data.description: Six airlines collaborating to provide additional 247 flights that will offer 73,388 extra seats

data.title: TCMA Champions Green Energy Transition with Collaborative Action
data.description: The   Thai Cement Manufacturers Association (TCMA)   is urging the government to accelerate the green energy transition by addressing legal and regulatory barriers,  facilitating  green funding, and promoting collaborative efforts under its   3C concept  :   Collaborative Mindset, Collaborative Action, and Collaborative Value  .

data.title: Cabinet may not set up Joint Technical Committee with Cambodia yet
data.description: Timing likely unworkable because of other commitments, defence minister says

data.title: Pichai to take BOI team to Shanghai roadshow to woo investors
data.description: The BOI delegation will also hold a special forum for Chinese investors to explore opportunities in Thailand’s growing industries

data.title: Bitkub’s Moodeang Shines in Times Square Spotlight
data.description: Bitkub Group has once again made waves on social media. Jirayut (Topp) Srupsrisopa, Founder and Group CEO of Bitkub Capital Group Holdings, Thailand’s leading digital asset and blockchain company, introduced the world to Moodeang, the beloved baby pygmy hippo adored by fans globally. Moodeang appeared on a vibrant animated display in New York’s Times Square, extending an invitation to people worldwide to visit Thailand.
